tools.gsf.time

Class LoggerStopwatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.gsf.time.LoggerStopwatch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stopwatch

    public final class LoggerStopwatch
extends Object
implements Stopwatch
    Stopwatch that records records into a logger. If the logger specified is not enabled at the debug level, this timer does nothing. Designed for performance measurements. Very lightweight object. Upon instantiation, the current time is measured once.
    Since:
    2016-07-17
    Author:
    Tony Field

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_LOGGER_NAME

        public static final String DEFAULT_LOGGER_NAME
        Default logger name used by this timer if no other logger is named.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MESSAGE_FORMAT_SPLIT

        public static final String MESSAGE_FORMAT_SPLIT
        Stopwatch message format string. This format will be used for all split measurements. The first {} marker will be replaced by the time in microseconds. The second marker will be replaced by the human-readable version of the time. The provided message will be appended to the end.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MESSAGE_FORMAT_ELAPSED

        public static final String MESSAGE_FORMAT_ELAPSED
        Stopwatch message format string. This format will be used for all cumulative measurements. The first {} marker will be replaced by the time in microseconds. The second marker will be replaced by the human-readable version of the time. The provided message will be appended to the end.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Stopwatch getInstance(org.slf4j.Logger logger)
        Create a logger stopwatch using the logger specified. If debug is not enabled, the NoopStopwatch is returned
        Parameters:
        logger - logger instance
        Returns:
        the stopwatch or the NoopStopwatch if debug is not enabled
        See Also:
        NoopStopwatch

      • getInstance

        public static Stopwatch getInstance()
        Create a stopwatch using the default logger, if debug is enabled. If debug is not enabled, the NoopStopwatch is returned.
        Returns:
        the stopwatch or the NoopStopwatch if debug is not enabled
        See Also:
        NoopStopwatch, DEFAULT_LOGGER_NAME

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: Stopwatch
        Starts the stopwatch. Must be called before taking a split or elapsed time.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Stopwatch

      • split

        public void split(String msg)
        Description copied from interface: Stopwatch
        Record time elapsed since the last interval measurement or since started/restarted. Resets the interval timer.
        Specified by:
        split in interface Stopwatch
        Parameters:
        msg - message to record (typically a description of the functionality measured, like a component name.)

                  Object... args)

        Record time elapsed since the last interval measurement or since started/restarted. Resets the interval timer.

      • elapsed

        public void elapsed(String msg)
        Description copied from interface: Stopwatch
        Record the elapsed time since the stopwatch was started/restarted. Does not reset either the interval timer or the cumulative timer.
        Specified by:
        elapsed in interface Stopwatch
        Parameters:
        msg - message to record (typically a description of the functionality measured, like a component name.)
